wikipedia_page.main: Major Peter Allen Norton, GC (born 10 December 1962) is a retired ammunition technical officer with the British Army's Royal Logistic Corps who was awarded the George Cross for his service in Iraq.

response: Peter Norton (born 1943) is an American programmer, software publisher, author, and philanthropist.
Peter Norton may also refer to:
* Peter Norton (British Army officer) (born 1962), recipient of the George Cross
* Peter Norton, proprietor of Pete's Eats Cafe, a cafe in Wales
* Peter Norton (historian), most known for critique of car-centric approaches
*Major Peter Norton GC – an officer with the British Army's Royal Logistic Corps who was awarded the George Cross (GC) for his service in Iraq.

One recipient of the FBI Star is Major Peter Norton of the British Army, who was severely injured when he triggered a secondary explosive device while attempting to clear an area where five American soldiers had been killed by a roadside bomb.  Norton was also awarded the George Cross—the highest British award for acts of gallantry which did not take place in action directly against enemy forces, and also awarded for civilian gallantry—for this incident.
